subject: Re: Unicode Status
msgSnippet: The glyph variation isn t critical for the font creation so let s use 10450 for PEA.  Do you have any other disagreements with your draft?  I believe I saw
messageBody:
The glyph variation isn't critical for the font creation so let's use 10450 for PEA. Do you have any other disagreements with your draft? I believe I saw some discussion with J'AI.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Michael Everson <everson@...> wrote:
>
> On 12 Apr 2013, at 03:22, Zyggy2 <jayson@...> wrote:
>
> The question is not whether PEA can be confused with TEA. The question is whether PEA is a glyph variant of PEEP. It seems to me that it is.
>
> > The submission can certainly go in with the arrangements you outlined. It looks like it was already decided to merge with the Shavian script which makes sense.
>
> To be frank, the likelihood of extensions to Shaving getting approved without me on board and behind the proposal is not very high. So the work needs to be done before anything gets to the committees.
>
> > We should get the proposal in and can discuss any revisions if the Consortium highlights issues.
>
> That isn't how it works. This is how it works:
>
> I say, I'm not entirely convinced that the unification has been scrutinized sufficiently. Is SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER PEA really a different character from SHAVIAN LETTER PEEP? It sure looks like a glyph variant to me.
>
> Then this issue is discussed and consensus is reached, and then a proposal is put forward.
>
> Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
>
